Reviews.Title: “Loved this Updated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJMGreenwich
Reviews.Content: Great location inside Old Town. If you are looking for a hotel that is not full service, just a clean, updated, compfortable place to stay, this is it. Walking distance to most restaurants. Try El Agave accross the street, real Mexican Food, not Americanized. I also recommend you ask for a room that over looks the courtyard, otherwise you'll have some street noise.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disorganized.”
Reviews.Author: PassTravelF00l
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on the first night of our trip and were quickly checked in and sent to our rooms but the key cards didn't work. This was an ongoing issue the entire stay. Sometimes the keys would allow us onto the property, sometimes they wouldn't but almost never did the keys allow us to enter our room. After two failed attempts on the night of our check in, the overnight handyman had to let us in and even his master key failed to open our door at first. The next day, the whole issue started over again. The rooms themselves are nice, the air conditioning works, the beds are comfortable, nice large TV's in the room with mini-fridges and such, overall pretty typical for Fairfield Inn's. I am an elite member with Marriott and have a standing request for the highest room available but that wasn't honored on this trip. I was placed on the second of three floors in the facility but the second floor is actually street level so we had people looking in at us for our stay. I hate having to keep the black out curtains closed for the entire stay but that is what we eventually had to do. The location is nice and other than the key card issue the hotel is fine. The staff was pleasant and helpful enough and the rooms were clean and comfortable but the layout of the facility is very odd and confusing. The next time I'm in San Diego I'll probably search elsewhere for a place to stay but I wouldn't offer a strong recommendation against or for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpful”
Reviews.Author: pickyreno
Reviews.Content: It is in old town and across the street is a nice resturant. The staff at check in were not helpful at all, they were rude, didn't even give us directions to where our room was and thought it funny that we took the elevators up to the building not connected to our room. The room itself had been renovated. The shuttle service was nice and even took us to streets in old town. The staff here obviously need some Marriott basic training in hotel service industry. Seriously, you must want to get annoyed if you stay here. There is an onsite laundry room with 1 w/d - yes just 1. The cooridors all are secured and locked between hallways requiring a key to enter every 100 feet....aah. It was very clean and I felt very safe. The breakfast ws standard. The pool was too cold for my taste, the hot tub was decent size. The lay out of the property was confusing. Beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “New ownership, newly remodeled, great service”
Reviews.Author: roeslers
Reviews.Content: Great location in Old Town. This hotel is entirely refurbished in 2012, under new ownership. Everything comfortable, clean. Refrigerations and microwaves in room. The staff at this hotel is very friendly and accommodating. FREE INTERNET, YAY! Breakfast is free but basic: waffles, microwave egg mcmuffins, toast, bagels, industrial muffins, fruit, cold cereal, instant oatmeal, coffee and juices. Nice pool area, small gym. Car parking costs $15 a month unless you want to try to get a spot on the street (possible, but very hard). No restaurant, although there are a lot of restaurants in Old Town (TRY BERTA'S LATIN AMERICAN----it is a standout gem in Old Town, easy walking distance from the hotel, and way better than some of the local tourist traps. Also 4250 Bakehouse and Bistro at 4250 Congress St is great----Berta's is right around the corner from it too.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hank C
Reviews.Content: . This property was a pleasant surprise. From the warm and friendly front desk greating, to the beautifully appointed guest rooms, dining and common areas, to the gourgous grounds. Just steps away from main street of Old Town, embraceing local and historical charm of early California, we truely enjoyed the "new" look and comfortability of this Fairfield Inn. Hank C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location In Old Town SD”
Reviews.Author: GHTfromHB
Reviews.Content: Very quick check-in at the front desk. We had a two queen bed room for our family of four. Rooms have been renovated and are very nice and comfortable. Nice flat screen t.v. but no high def. The free wi-fi was a plus and worked well. Beds were comfortable and although our room was overlooking the street, we still found that it was quiet with very little street noise. The breakfast was very good and was very comparable to other Fairfield Marriotts that we have stayed at. A very short walk to the main part of Old Town too so the location was very convenient not only to Old Town but to Interstate 5 as well! All in all a pleasant two night stay for our family over Easter break. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Walls paper thin? or hotel security guard being a jerk?”
Reviews.Author: tmongb
Reviews.Content: Everything was just fine(nice room, nice hotel staff) until... I checked in on a friday night and my friend and I came back around 2-3am. We approached our room and started getting ready for bed. In our room, we heard banging on our wall from another room. We looked at each other in surprise and continued to get ready for bed. About 15 minutes later, we were already in bed and get a knock on the door from the security guard. The security guard basically talked down to me as if I was some punk trying to wreak havoc at the hotel and literally tells me that I am 'talking too loud.' Really?!?!? I wanted to ask him if I was making trouble anywhere in the hotel or running around and making noise, because I don't know what I was doing wrong. The loudest thing I could think that my friend and I could have done was just talk, but we were not screaming or laughing at all. But I decided to comply with whatever 'demands' he wanted from me because I already did not want trouble or get kicked out of the hotel. He really upseted me because I do not believe I had done anything wrong and he was being a complete jerk to me. Are your walls paper thin? or does your security guard have some power trip and was bored?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Mike
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Can walk everywhere and reasonable price. Breakfast was good. It is nicer than staying in the noisy downtown pricey area. We are platinum members and this hotel was better than A JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, newly-renovated, great location, cool layout.”
Reviews.Author: brookl
Reviews.Content: This place is newly-renovated recently, and overall we had a great stay. The location is terrific, as it is right off I-5 with immediate access to/from the freeway either north/southbound. The main part of Old Town is within a short walk. The hotel offers not only free airport shuttle, but also shuttle to/from Seaworld and SD Zoo. Free shuttle to Seaworld and Zoo has to be pretty rare for any of the area hotels, and it made things real convenient although the caveat is I believe they only offer one set dropoff/pickup times per day. Our room came with a wet bar (sink) and microwave/fridge. Not sure if every room comes with a wet bar, but I think there's microwave/fridge in every room. Of course, the Internet is free. The lobby area has two computers for guest use, as well as a color printer. I will say that the lobby computers were extremely slow. The free breakfast buffet was very good. As with all Fairfield Inn's, it had Jimmy Dean microwaveable sausage muffins. Also had cereals (good selection), fruits (limited selection), muffins/bread, yogurt and packaged cups of grapefruits and pineapples. Although there was no prepared hot food items on offer, I found the breakfast buffet to be still good. Coffee was terrible, though. The dining area in the lobby is modern-looking and nicely done. Very interesting layout. This place is made up of 4 different buildings, each with rooms that are accessed via interior corridor like most highrise hotels. But the buildings are connected via outdoor corridors like at motels, and some of the rooms are actually accessed from the outdoor part of the corridor. So there are some rooms here that have motel-like exterior access setup. The four buildings form an arc that surrounds a courtyard area which has nice tables, sofas to lounge in, as well as pool/spa. Our room was a 1-king facing the courtyard, and it was spacious. Looked like fairly new carpeting. The bed was a little soft, but the bedding was very comfortable. Nice towels, too. Overall the room felt very clean, although I still don't think that the housekeeping did such a great job of cleaning because I saw dust at the edges of the carpet along the wall. When this place is no longer new, the housekeeping will need to do a better job of upkeeping this place to keep it looking clean. One thing that's not free here (although typically free at other Fairfield Inns) is parking. It's $15/night to park underground in their gated garage. There's possible street parking nearby, but street parking near the hotel was completely occupied most nights that I was there. So I suggest you just suck it up and pay in their garage. One important thing to remember, though, is that this place has a very low garage clearance (6 feet).

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda M
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night at this hotel as I was heading on down to San Ignacio for a trip to see the gray whales; however, the hotel certainly met all my expectations. It had just recently changed ownership and there was still some work going on to upgrade the hotel, but nothing to incovenience the guests. The room I had was obviously newly remodeled and extremely comfortable. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! The decor was modern and tasteful and the room was very clean. Hotel staff was friendly and the shuttle service picked me up promptly when I called to say I had arrived at the airport. The continental breakfast was pretty much the normal menu and certainly met my needs. The hotel was within walking distance of many restaurtants. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimplzjs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely remodeled and very nice. Had awesome pillows. Breakfast in the morning was good and had a nice area to eat. The location is awesome in regards to old town. It is literally on the corner and you just walk a block or so and you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property-delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaCassidy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 night in February so we could go to Sea World. The staff was attentive to our needs and the rooms were clean and well maintained. The beds were so comfortable I didn't want to get out of it in the morning! Every morning breakfast is served and you can make your own waffles-yummy. They also have breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, muffins, cereal and oatmeal. You won't leave hungry. Overall I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: samcoronado
Reviews.Content: This property used to be a Holiday Inn, recently converted to a Fairfield Inn, It's fresh from top to bottom with a contemporary look, bubbling fountains, beautiful grounds, the latest in technology and a friendly and welcoming staff. The rooms are quiet, big and clean, with local art, comfortable beds, flat screen TVs and an ipod docking clock. The FREE breakfast has many choices of oatmeal, yogurts, fresh fruit, make-your-own waffles, cereals and pastries. In addition to table seating, there is a long communal table with power outlets so you can eat and check your email at the same time. Gym has all new equipment with individual TVs and there is a nice pool and jacuzzi. It is also convenient - the freeway onramp (and two gas stations) are just blocks away, no fighting through traffic to start home. I would stay here again when I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel trying to be passed off as New”
Reviews.Author: sbktravels
Reviews.Content: Ok, I hate to bash anyone, But I gave the Marriott time to respond. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again; period. They claim it is a new hotel; yes it is new to the Marriott, but far from New. I stayed for 2 nights and that was 2 nights too long. The first room had an awful smell to it and they switched me to the only other room available which was a few doors down. Both rooms had an awful Plastic / Meth smell to it. The rooms are not secure as the hotel is 3 stories and a 3 foot wall keeps the outside separated. The elevator does not work and the staff is very unfriendly. The breakfast is below subpar. Stay away unless they make major improvements. VERY DISAPPOINTED and will not be coming back. Charged you parking across the street. NO Security.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: This states to be a new hotel in Marriott website. This looks like remodel from previous business. So, you would have the window but can't go out to patio. They have new equipment and clean facilities everywhere. However, The front desk is a little bit too slow. Other than that, everything is good in this hotel. New bed sheet, new restroom, new ... Worth to mention that they offer real fruit and real fruit juice in package. But, don't drink the juice from fountain machine. It's like 3:1 water to juice.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lgrossbard
Reviews.Content: Great spot. Thought I was staying at a Holiday Inn Express but apparently they changed the name. The real treat is how they changed the hotel! Wow! Great looking hotel rooms, Great free breakfast! Finally the Wi-Fi really works all over the place! Worth the extra money to stay in a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for an end-of-trip stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in May 2011 when the hotel was still a Holiday Inn Express. Since it sounds like there have been a lot of changes since then, I'm only going to comment on the location. We chose to stay in Old Town on the tail of a trip to Palm Springs. We wanted to see a different area of San Diego and, location-wise, this hotel delivered. We found easy street parking across from the hotel and didn't move our car until the next morning when it was time to head to the airport. So, don't be afraid to park on the street! The hotel is in easy walking distance to plenty of restaurants and the Old Town historic park. We caught the Saturday market, and walked over a few blocks to explore the great houses in Heritage Park.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites San Diego Old Town
HotelInfo.Address: 3900 Old Town Avenue, San Diego, CA 92110 (Formerly Mission Inn Old Town)
